entry.title: How to retrieve open AR items including partial payments in Custom CDS View (same as F0711)?
entry.content:
Title:
How to retrieve open AR items including partial payments in Custom CDS View (same as F0711)?
Body:
Objective:
I need to create a custom CDS view that retrieves the same open AR line items as the standard Fiori app F0711 (Manage Customer Line Items) in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition.
Current Situation:
I'm using I_JournalEntryOperationalView as the primary data source with the following WHERE clause:


ClearingDate = '00000000'
AND IsOpenItemManaged = 'X'
AND (AccountingDocumentType = 'RV'
OR AccountingDocumentType = 'DR')
```

**Problem:**
This condition works for most cases, but **it excludes items with partial payments**. When a partial payment is posted, the `ClearingDate` field gets populated (e.g., '20230713'), even though the item still has an outstanding balance.

**Example:**
- Journal Entry: 1800000000
- Line Item: 000001
- `ClearingDate`: '20230713' (not '00000000')
- `IsOpenItemManaged`: 'X'
- Status in F0711: **Open (Clearing Status = 2)**
- Status in my CDS View: **Excluded** (due to ClearingDate filter)

**Question:**
Which field(s) should I use to correctly identify open items including partially cleared items, matching the logic of F0711?

I've tried:
- `ClearingJournalEntry` (empty check)
- `ClearingAccountingDocument` (empty check)
- `ReceivableFinancingStatus` (not populated in our system)

**Additional Info:**
- System: SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
- Data Source: `I_JournalEntryOperationalView`
- Fiori App: F0711 - Manage Customer Line Items

Any guidance would be greatly appreciated!

entry.title: Calculating surcharges on contract manufacturing
entry.content:
Hello,

I would like to calculate a material with surcharges that has a contract manufacturing component. The value is taken from an info record for the calculation. The material has the special procurement key 30. When I calculate now, no surcharges are determined. If I remove Sobsl 30, surcharges are calculated, but subcontracting is no longer taken into account.

Does anyone have any idea why this might be?

entry.title: Update US Tax Rates error Valid from date of jur cd &1 is before valid from date in customizing
entry.content:
In Configuration Activity 101016 - Define Tax Codes for Sales and Purchases or App Upload Tax Rates (F2609) a tax rate needs to be created with validity date prior to that of existing tax rates. 

Error messages if an existing tax rate is changed in the past:

  1. Configuration Activity 101016 - Define Tax Codes for Sales and Purchases: “Valid from date of jur cd &1 is before valid from date in customizing”.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: SAP IAG Access Request Status audit logs
entry.content:
Seeking advisory guidance on SAP Cloud Identity Access Governance (8010452)

The IAG customer would like to generate a report that shows access requests approved by an individual user or their team members.

In addition, they would like to view audit logs within the Access Request Status app. Is it possible to enable this?

Currently, the available IAG reports are administrative reports that display all access requests and therefore cannot be shared with business users.

entry.title: Payment Block Not Transferred to AR Line Item from Billing Document in S/4HANA Public Cloud
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

We are facing an issue with payment block transfer in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition.

Issue Description:

When we create a billing document with a payment term that has a payment block setting, the payment block is not transferred to the AR line item of the automatically posted accounting document.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Created a payment term with payment block reason (e.g., `A` - All items)
2. Created a sales order using this payment term
3. Created a billing document (VF01) referring to the sales order
4. Checked the accounting document posted automatically from the billing document
5. Result: Payment block is missing in the AR line item (Customer line)

Expected Behavior:

The payment block should be transferred from the payment term to the AR line item, so that the invoice is excluded from automatic payment runs.

On-Premise Solution:

In S/4HANA On-Premise, SAP Note 132701 instructs us to implement a User Exit to transfer the payment block from billing document to accounting document.

Question:

How can we achieve this in S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition?

- Is there a standard configuration to enable this?
- Should we use a specific Business Add-In (BAdI)?
- Is there a custom logic app or extension required?
- Are there any SAP Notes or best practices for this scenario in Public Cloud?

Environment:

- SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition (latest release)
- Activated scope items: 1G1 (Sell from Stock), BDG (Accounts Receivable)

Any guidance would be greatly appreciated.

Thank you in advance!

entry.title: Redirect output item in S4 Public Cloud
entry.content:
Hello,

I'm in a situation where my warehouse will move to 1 site to another one.

So the output for delivery (for example or warehouse order) need to be printed in 2 different printers in 2 different sites.

I read a lot of documentation and if I understand well we have a relation 1 to 1 between the print queue and the physical printer (https://me.sap.com/notes/2757763/E)

So I was thinking to set my printing to DEFAULT and then the user manually set the output item to the right printing (Until the move ends).
I saw in this documentation that you can edit the output item with status "In preparation" : "https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/a630d57fc5004c6383e7a81efee7a8bb/dc2fa399c50f4a32a2513130ad0531eb.html?locale=en-US"

but I could find the way in my system, in the "Manage Output Item" App, I have the only option  "sent":

Thanks,

Emmanuel.

entry.title: Overhead Cost Calculation on WBS – No Results Generated
entry.content:
Hello,

I am launching the overhead cost calculation for a WBS element on SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud. The WBS element has a costing sheet and budget availability control activated. After the calculation is completed, the system indicates that the calculation was successful, but no results are generated.

1) Run execution :

2)  WBS elemnt : 

 

3) Costing sheet :

 

4) Base :

 

5) Credit : 

 

FYI : The costs posted to the WBS come from FB60 as well as from the MM flow (ME21N → MIGO → MIRO), and they are visible in the project budget report under actual costs (AVC).

Could you please help me identify the reason for this issue?

Thank you in advance.

entry.title: SAP Public Cloud 2508 / Issues during the Maintenance of Partner Roles for Business Partners
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

i have the following question for the maintenance of partner functions with the app "maintain business partner master data".
My Scenario is the following, i have a Business partner with the BP-Role "customer" and i have a BP with the BP-Role "contact person".
I want to assign this contact person to a custom partner function for this customer. When i go to the section partner roles in the sales area data of the customer, i can create a new entry with the custom partner function and then i have to select the business partner. 

At this point its important to mention that the system is customized in way, that this partner function only accepts contact persons as entries. So the BP with the BP role contact person has to have a contact person relationship and this relationship has a number assigned to it, which the SAP System reffers to as the "Partner number" (PARNR).

This number now has to be selected, when i want to assign the partner role and not the BP number that the contact person has.

If i want to do this in the older App/Transaction "BP" i cant just go to the partner role section and for the selection of the BP, i can filter the list to only those relationships that are related to this Customer.

BUT if i want to do the same thing in the new App, i have to know the exact number of the relationship, because the app displays all relationships for all customers and i cant filter it in the same way.
The second issue is, that the Partner number i need to know, is also not displayed in the section "contact persons" in the customer or enywhere else and only the BP number of this contact person is displayed there.
As a result the only solutions i have found so far are, to use the Transaction "BP" or to use a custom CDS View to view the "partner number".

My question is, is this the standard behavoir ? Is there no way to filter the realtionships in a same way as in the Transaction BP ? Is there a standard way to display the "Partner number" in the app "Manage Business Partner Master Data", or do i need to create a custom field ?

Im greatfull for all answers and tipps.
Best regards
Lukas

entry.title: Custom fields for enterprise search (SAP Cloud ERP)
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

we are currently working on extending Enterprise Search in order to make our custom fields searchable across different business scenarios.

In several cases, this worked as expected. For some business objects, we were able to enable the relevant ESH_* CDS views directly within the custom field.

This then allowed us to add these fields to the corresponding search model in Manage Enterprise Search.

As a result, multiple custom fields could be successfully used in Enterprise Search.

However, we have encountered a limitation for other business scenarios. For objects such as Purchase Orders and Outbound Deliveries, no ESH_* CDS views are available. Additionally, in the Manage Enterprise Search app, the option to add custom fields to the search model is not offered for these business objects.

As a consequence, several of our custom fields cannot be made available via Enterprise Search, even though the business requirement is comparable to scenarios where this functionality is supported. This leads to an inconsistent user experience and makes it more difficult for users to efficiently find related transactions across documents.

This raises the following questions:

  • Why is Enterprise Search not supported consistently across all business scenarios in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition?

  • Is there any supported workaround to make custom fields for Purchase Orders (or Outbound Deliveries) searchable via Enterprise Search?

  • Is Enterprise Search support for custom fields in Purchase Orders and Outbound Deliveries planned or currently discussed on the SAP roadmap?

Thank you very much in advance for your insights and experiences.

Best regards,
Marlene

entry.title: Purchase Order Output Time Stamp Time Zone in S4HANA Public Cloud
entry.content:
SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud enforces UTC timestamps on PO outputs, and conversion to a different Time Zone isn’t supported at the output level.

Is this a hard restriction? I mean, all S4 Cloud businesses will need to see UTC on their PO outputs regardless they are in Asia, Europe, Australia, Africa or Americas?
